text: Hi, I'm Anna Green,
Head of Small and Medium Business
for AWS across Asia Pacific and Japan.
Welcome to Business Builders.

I'm really excited to
welcome Brenton Spear,
CEO of carbonTRACK,
to talk to us today about sustainability,
energy and technology.
Welcome, Brenton.
I'm really excited to hear about the way

that you are using
technology in your business.
And I'd love to start by just framing out

what is carbonTRACK's
purpose, strategy and vision.

- Hi Anna, it's great
to speak with you today.

carbonTRACK's primary focus
was to provide our customers

with a management system
to manage their energy
in the most sustainable way possible.

So through our carbonTRACK
energy management platform,
we've been able to save our customers
362,000 tons of CO2 equivalent.
That equates to 5.2 billion kilometers
in an electric vehicle.
- That's really interesting.

And I think, again, speaks
to the broader conversation
that I'd like to dive a bit deeper on,

which is what is the role
of software and technology
in improving energy efficiency?

- I think to ensure that we
understand energy and its usage,
we actually have to make sure
we have the information and the data.
We have so much information coming from
so many different solutions and sensors.

We need to package all
of that information up.
And AWS allows us to do exactly that.

It puts all of the information
right where we need it,

so we can then provide
that to our customer,

and they can use that
information the best way possible
to then get specific outcomes
and manage their energy as best they can.

- For us, the use of technology
is really about offloading
the undifferentiated heavy lifting

that our customers have
to do on technology

so they can really focus
on running their business.

So I guess another
question around that is,

how do your teams use
technology to help you
not to focus on technology to some extent
and focus on the business?
- Our purpose is to make sure

that we give our outcomes
for our customers.

So the best way to do
that is to utilize the AWS
as a building block.

And that provides the
technology infrastructure
that allows us to scale,
to ingest information,
and then we can focus on the technology
and building solutions for our customers

to give them the absolute
best outcomes we possibly can.
And through doing that,

we're saving customers up to
30% on their energy bills,
which is an amazing outcome.
- Yes, that's a great outcome.
You know, I think any business
that's saving 30% is happy.

And then to be able to do that
with a sustainability context

is even more fantastic,
certainly for customers,
but also our communities.
So, tell us a few of your stories

or maybe one or two of
the stories that you have.

- We had one specific customer,
which was always memorable.
They had a very large warehouse
and within that warehouse,

they had a number of
forklifts that were electric.

And they couldn't understand
why there was such a spike
in their energy usage in the mornings.

What we found was, the
foreman would come in

and turn on all of the electric
forklifts at the same time.

And that would peak the
actual energy usage.

So through the carbonTRACK
energy management system
and the monitoring and the data,

we were able to understand
exactly why this was occurring,

and then look at the period
of time when it was occurring,

and then put all of those
forklifts on a schedule
and start at different times.

That put all of the
value of the energy lower
and saved them considerable amount.

And I think we saved
them over 30% as well,
which was an amazing outcome.
- I love those customer stories.
And it leads to my next question which is,
what comes next for carbonTRACK?
And I guess more importantly,

how can we help you to get
there using cloud technology?

- The last 12 months, Anna,
has been amazing for us.
We've grown so much in the period.
So what we're really focusing on now
is scaling our business,
moving towards other areas

for our business to grow
into other countries.

And by utilizing AWS
and the building blocks,
we can actually quite easily do that.
- Well, it's a really fantastic story,
carbonTRACK and what you've achieved,

and do you have any tips
for other businesses

who might be looking
for new ways to deliver

socially impactful and
sustainable solutions at scale?

- I think the most important
thing is to provide
information to the customer.

When the customer
understands the information
and understands what's happening,

they can then make really
informed decisions.

- I mean, customer obsession,
delivering results.
There's just so much that you are doing

that aligns with what
AWS is also aligned to.

I just wanna stop and
say thank you so much
for taking the time, Brenton,
just to share your journey with us.

Obviously, we are so
happy to partner with you

as you're building what
are sustainable solutions

for all of the communities
in which we operate.
Congratulations to you and your team,

and I look forward to
working with you very closely

in the future, to helping
you build and grow.
Thanks so much for your time, Brenton.
- Thank you so much, Anna.
